blush.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: to become red in the face, usually because you are embarrassed
blush.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: Wilson saw she was watching him and blushed.
Joan blushed at the unexpected compliment.
blush.translation[0].definitions[0].note: In everyday British English, people often say go red rather than blush:
She went red when he looked at her.
blush.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: to feel ashamed or embarrassed about something
blush.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: I blush to admit that I havenâ€™t read it.
blush.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: the red colour on your face that appears when you are embarrassed
blush.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: Donald felt a blush warm his cheeks.
She bent her head to hide her blushes.
